metadata.description:
this piece holds a very special place in my heart. arguably the most personal + emotional music i've ever made. some who have listened to this have told me it feels like they are evoking core memories and watching their own lives.

i've never shared this with anyone other than the person this piece is about, but the title comes from a poem from Shel Silverstein. this is how it goes:

“She had blue skin,
And so did he.
He kept it hid
And so did she.
They searched for blue
Their whole life through,
Then passed right by-
And never knew.”

the way i see it is that two souls may cross paths for a second or even have the fortune of experiencing many moments together without really knowing how similar and kindred they really are. sometimes you really can't tell unless you give people a chance and enough time to open up. sometimes it takes a lot to realize what you're walking by or letting go of.

this track is my personal soundtrack to one blue skin encounter i had. i hope it brings you memories of your own. perhaps you've also had many "almost encounters" or short ones that could've been much more.

much love.
metadata.name: blue skin #1
metadata.title: blue skin
